instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
Charger light green, but switches off after a while. Power rails stay as below whether light is off or on.

No fans

PPBUS_G3H = 8.4V
PP3V42_G3H_REG = 3.4V
P5V_S3_REG = 0V, no short to ground
P5VS3_EN &  PM_SLP_S4_L = 0V, no short to ground
PP1V05_S5_MCP = 1.1V

MCP does not heat up.

Anything left to look at other than blaming the MCP?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H is at 8.4V which could indicate an issue with the SMC

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Using a REAL APPLE 85W charger? These do not auto power on, need to short power on pads.

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
[USER="289"]smiba[/USER] - Its actually 8.41 according to my multimeter, which isn't all that accurate, though it performs amazingly well for the pos it is.

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] I'm using a real charger. Don't own a fake. I tried both shorting the pads at R5015 (without keyboard cable inserted) and using the power button with the cable inserted. SMC_ONOFF_L is at 3.4V.
I swapped the magsafe to rule that out - no change.

Further: According to the customer the problem started out of the blue, no moisture damage spotted on the board or inside the laptop, though I havent completely disassembled it. It was fairly dusty at the fans (smoker), but not clogged up and the fans still spin ok by hand.

edit: seems green charger light switching off as mentioned earlier might just have been due to an imperfect connection between charger and magsafe board. I havent seen the light turn off anymore.

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: ADAPTER_EN high? Resistance to GND on 3V42?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 25193"]ADAPTER_EN high? Resistance to GND on 3V42?[/QUOTE]

ADAPTER_EN is high (3.39V)

resistance to GND on PP3V42_G3H = 14k

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: 3v3_s5 present? Replace C7771 just to be sure.

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
3v3_s5 is at 3.3V
PP1V2R1V05_S5 is at 1.1V

C7771 replaced, no change. (I checked the cap with my ESR meter, its 362uF and 0.0ESR, so was almost certainly fine to start with).

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Checked all rails for shorts? Check 5V_S3 while pressing the power button, is there a pulse?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG

Is the resistance for the PPVCORE rail normally that low?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Vcore is normal. This is starting to look like an SMC or MCP problem :( Have you tried booting from a charged battery?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
I charged the battery with this board, verified that its working (bat gave ~7V first, ~12 after charging a while). Going to let it charge a little longer, but right now there is no fan spin when trying to power it up with the battery in (tried with magsafe in and out). Not very hopeful.
Can I check wheter its the SMC or MCP somehow? The SMC I could probably replace, though I'm still waiting for my jig to show up from China and have yet to do my first replacement, but it should wind up here eventually.

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: SMS_ONOFF_L toggling when you press power?

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Toggling? As in, being pulled back to ground when I hit the button and coming back up when I release it? If so, yes it is

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Same for the SLP_S3? If nothing happens there check the RTC Xtal for 32KHz

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S3_L has 0V, no short to ground. Thats another one that should be generated by the MCP, yes?

I think the crystal is working, I've added screencaps of my scope for both pins



[ATTACH alt="RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN.jpg - RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN" type="full" width="320px"]25378._xfImport[/ATTACH]
RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN


[ATTACH alt="RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT.jpg - RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT" type="full" width="320px"]25379._xfImport[/ATTACH]
RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: I'm seeing 25MHz, you need to measure RTC Xtal and that should have 32KHz

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
Boardview lists multiple XTals, I figured you wanted to see RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT or IN.
Is it SMC_XTAL_R / SMC_EXTAL at Y5010 you want? Its the one right by the SMC.
If so, reading is below. Schematic says its a 20MHZ crystal, so says the scope as well.
I dont know how to measure the 32KHz its supposed to be putting out, I haven't tested a crystal beyond checking whether there is a wave or not.

[ATTACH alt="SMC_XTAL.jpg - Click image for larger version  Name:	SMC_XTAL.jpg Views:	1 Size:	34.7 KB ID:	25417" type="full" width="30%"]25417._xfImport[/ATTACH]

SMC_XTAL

[ATTACH alt="SMC_XTAL_R.jpg - Click image for larger version  Name:	SMC_XTAL_R.jpg Views:	1 Size:	35.8 KB ID:	25418" type="full" width="30%"]25418._xfImport[/ATTACH]

SMC_XTAL_R

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message:
I got my measurements mixed up earlier, measured at the wrong crystal. Sorry about that. Here's the actual RTC XTAL:


[ATTACH alt="RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN.jpg" type="full" width="320px"]25451._xfImport[/ATTACH]

[ATTACH alt="RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT_R.jpg" type="full" width="320px"]25452._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: 820-2610 - missing P5V_S3_REG
threads.message: Well, that pretty much leaves a dead MCP or SMC.
